incidents.name: Issue With Twilio's Status Page Portal where the Internet of Things Section Was Removed

incident_updates.body: We have sent notifications to impacted customers subscribed to the “Internet of things” components to recreate any previous subscriptions they had for IoT products.

We're still continuing to investigate with our provider if the deleted subscriptions can be restored. In case those subscriptions cannot be restored, you should recreate your subscriptions to Status Page updates for Internet of Things products. We'll give another update in the next 8 hours or so.

We're still investigating with our provider if the deleted subscriptions can be restored. In case those subscriptions cannot be restored, you should recreate your subscriptions to Status Page updates for Internet of Things products. We'll give another update in the next 4 hours or so.

We're still investigating with our provider if the deleted subscriptions can be restored. In case those subscriptions cannot be restored, you should recreate your subscriptions to Status Page updates for Internet of Things products. We'll give another update in 2 hours.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Around 21:00 UTC, the Internet of Things section was removed from the Twilio Status Page. When it was removed, if you were subscribed to Status Page updates for Super SIM & Programmable Wireless, you may have received an email saying you were automatically unsubscribed. We have added the Internet of Things section back to the Status Page; however, subscriptions to Status Page updates were not restored. We are investigating with our provider if the deleted subscriptions can be restored. In case those subscriptions cannot be restored, you should recreate your subscriptions to Status Page updates for Internet of Things products.

We will give you an update in 1 hour.

incidents.name: MMS Delivery Delays or Failures From US Subscribers to a Subset of Twilio's Short Codes

incident_updates.body: After monitoring for some time, we started seeing a degradation of the service. We're experiencing MMS delivery delays or failures from/to US subscribers to a subset of Twilio short codes. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Connectivity Lost on 3.55% of Super SIM Devices

incident_updates.body: Connectivity on Super SIM Devices has been restored. We will close the post on Twilio’s Status Page. If you have been impacted by this incident and wish to continue to receive updates, please open a ticket with customer support.

Beginning at 20:28 UTC, we observed 3.5% of total data sessions on Super SIM being dropped. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the redundant instances while the impacted one recovered. Our engineering team is actively working with the affected network provider to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 2 hours or sooner once more information becomes available.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Super SIM data sessions drops. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Automated Alert: No Customer Impact

incident_updates.body: We have fully investigated the Programmable Messaging issue triggered by our automated alert, and it was determined that there is no noticeable customer impact. All systems are operational.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Programmable Messaging. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Connectivity Lost on ~35% of Super SIM Devices

incident_updates.body: The issue with Super SIM Devices connectivity has been resolved and services are operating normally at this time.

We are now seeing recovery of the previously reported connectivity issue. We are continuing to monitor for service stability. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Beginning at 00:45 UTC, we observed ~35% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the network using a secondary IMSI. Currently, we are still monitoring the situation as approximately 15% of devices may still experience connectivity issues. These devices might encounter poor data connection or have short-lived sessions and as such are not able to successfully perform an IMSI switching procedure. Our engineering team is actively working alongside the affected network provider to resolve the issue as quickly as possible. In the meantime, we kindly suggest that customers reset the connectivity through the console if they notice that some of their SIM cards are still experiencing issues. This can often help re-establish a stable connection for the affected devices. We will provide another update in 4 hours or sooner once more information becomes available.

Beginning at 00:45 UTC, we observed ~35% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the network using a secondary IMSI. Our engineering team is actively working with the affected network provider to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 2 hours or sooner once more information becomes available.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with SuperSIM connectivity. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Issues With a Daily Message Cap Being Applied to Some Customers and Auth Tokens Being Automatically Rotated

incident_updates.body:
Messaging cap restrictions have been resolved for impacted customers.

If you are still experiencing issues with your Twilio integration, log on to Console and verify that the Auth Token on Console and your application are the same. If they are different, update your application with the new Auth Token on Console.

Messaging cap restrictions have been resolved for impacted customers.

If you are still experiencing issues with your Twilio integration, log on to Console and verify that the Auth Token on Console and your application are the same. If they are different, update your application with the new Auth Token on Console. We expect to provide another update in 30 mins or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified the issue that resulted in the message cap being applied, and auth tokens being rotated. We are currently in the process of reverting the caps. If you have any issues with your API integration, or experience failures when sending messages, please log into your Twilio console and check that you’re using the current auth token. We expect to provide another update in 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified the issue that resulted in the message cap being applied. We are currently in the process of reverting the caps for the impacted accounts. We expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We continue investigating an issue with a message cap being applied. Customers may experience a daily message cap of 500 messages per day. We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are investigating an issue with a message cap being applied. Customers may experience a daily message cap of 500 messages per day. We expect to provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with a message cap of 500 daily messages being applied. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Connectivity Lost on ~5% of Super SIM Devices on AT&T

incident_updates.body: Between 7:30 AM UTC and 8:00 AM UTC we observed ~5%  of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped and quickly reconnected. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the redundant instances while the impacted one recovered. However, we kindly suggest that customers reset the connectivity through the console if they notice that some of their SIM cards are still experiencing issues. This can often help re-establish a stable connection for the affected devices.

incident_updates.body: Network connectivity issue has been resolved and service is operating normally at this time.

We are still seeing recovery of the network connectivity issue. We are continuing to monitor for service stability. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are now seeing recovery of the network connectivity issue while the affected devices are reconnecting. We are continuing to monitor for service stability. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are experiencing Super SIM connectivity issues. Beginning at 02:48 UTC, we observed ~5% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the redundant instances while the impacted one recovered. Our engineering team is actively working with the affected network provider to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or sooner once more information becomes available.

incident_updates.body: We are experiencing SMS delivery delays when sending messages to Etisalat and DU networks in United Arab Emirates using Domestic Sender ID's. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

affected_components.name: CARRIER NETWORK - SMS, Middle East & Africa
